resources.string: Check items as you add them to your cart. Track your shopping progress below.
Filter recipes by your preference. When you find one you like click on the recipe for more details.
Mash a ripe avocado with a squeeze of lemon juice and a pinch of salt. \nSpread it evenly on a toasted slice of bread. \nSprinkle with red pepper flakes for a bit of heat.
Whisk two eggs with a splash of milk, salt, and pepper.\nMelt butter in a pan, pour in the eggs, and gently scramble until cooked through but still moist. \nServe immediately.
Combine a can of drained tuna with mayonnaise, diced celery, and a squeeze of lemon juice.\nMix well and season with salt and pepper. \nServe on lettuce or bread.
Slice fresh mozzarella and ripe tomatoes. \nArrange them on a plate, alternating slices. \nDrizzle with olive oil, balsamic glaze, and sprinkle with fresh basil leaves.
Combine rolled oats, water or milk, and a pinch of salt in a microwave-safe bowl.\nMicrowave for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.\nTop with fruit and nuts.

Sauté: In a wok or large skillet add 1 Tablespoon olive oil over medium high heat. Add bell pepper, peas, carrots, mushrooms, broccoli, baby corn, and water chestnuts. Sauté 2-3 minutes until veggies are almost tender.
Whisk: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, garlic, brown sugar, sesame oil, chicken broth, and cornstarch.
Mix: Pour over veggies and cook until the sauce has thickened.
Garnish: add chopped green onions and sesame seeds if desired.

Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Sauté onion until lightly browned.
Stir in garlic, curry powder, cinnamon, paprika, bay leaf, ginger, sugar, and salt. Continue stirring for 2 minutes.
Add chicken pieces, tomato paste, yogurt, and coconut milk. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 20-25 minutes.
Remove bay leaf, and stir in lemon juice and cayenne pepper. Simmer 5 more minutes.
Serve hot and enjoy!

Prep:
1. Cut beef into small chunks, along with potatoes and carrots
2. Season beef chunks with salt and pepper, then sprinkle with flour and toss to coat

Cooking:
1. Set Instant Pot to sauté mode. Add oil and brown beef for 3-4 minutes. Remove and set aside
2. Add onions and garlic to pot. Cook for 2-3 minutes until brown and soft
3. Pour in broth to deglaze, scraping up brown bits from bottom. Stir for 1 minute
4. Add tomato paste, seasoning, and Worcestershire sauce. Stir for 2 minutes
5. Return beef to pot, top with potatoes and carrots. Add bay leaf

Pressure Cooking:
1. Close lid, set steam release valve to seal
2. Cook on high pressure for 35 minutes
3. Allow 10 minute natural release before opening
4. Remove bay leaf before serving
